identificationModule.briefTitle: Early Injection of Botulinum Toxin on Motor Function and Gait Pattern in Stroke Patients

responsibleParty.investigatorTitle: Director, Physical Medical and Rehabilitation, Principal Investigator, Clinical Professor

descriptionModule.briefSummary:
Spasticity, muscle weakness, abnormal gait pattern are co-morbidities commonly seen in stroke patients. They cause disabled condition of patients in activities of daily life and functional performance, and also accidental falls and subsequent fractures.

This study is to evaluate and compare the effects of different phase injection of Botulinum Toxin Type-A at affected limbs on muscle rheological changes, muscle activity, muscle tone, functional performance, gait pattern and energy consumption in stroke patients.

armGroups.label: Botox_A
armGroups.description: receiving Botulinum Toxin Type-A (Botox-A, Allergan) at both affected lower extremity (aLE) and upper extremity (aUE)

armGroups.label: placebo_A
armGroups.description: receiving placebo injection at both aLE \& aUE ; receiving Botox-A at both aLE \& aUE at 6-month.

armGroups.label: Botox_B
armGroups.description: receiving Botox-A injection at aLE and placebo injection (sterile normal saline) at aUE.

armGroups.label: placebo_B
armGroups.description: receiving placebo injection at both aLE \& aUE ; receiving Botox-A only at aLE at 6-month.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Change in the muscle tone in upper and lower extremity
primaryOutcomes.description:
use modified Ashworth Scale to access elbow, wrist, ankle joint muscle tone 0: normal

1. slight hypertonus, at the end-range 1+: mild hypertonus, catch when limb is moved (\<1/2)
2. moderate hypertonus,, limbs moves easily (\>1/2)
3. passive movement difficult
4. rigid

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change in the gait pattern as walking

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* first-ever stroke, with spasticity within 3-months (MAS=2\~3)
* independent walking 10 meters (with assistive devices)

Exclusion Criteria:

* recurrent stroke, cognition impaired
* lower limb fracture
* received anti-spasticity injection in the past
